sentences.en: "Welcome back" was all they said. I could have kissed them!
sentences.cn: 他们只是说，“欢迎回来。”我真想亲他们一下！

sentences.en: Bake some big red peppers and hollow them out.
sentences.cn: 将几个大红甜椒烤一烤，再把它们掏空。

sentences.en: For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbours, and laugh at them in our turn?
sentences.cn: 我们活着是为了什么？不就是给邻居当笑柄，再反过来笑他们。

sentences.en: Four of them had gone off to find help.
sentences.cn: 他们中的4个人去寻求帮助了。

sentences.en: Has anyone seen my keys? I can’t find them anywhere.
sentences.cn: 有人见到我的钥匙吗？我哪儿都找不到。

sentences.en: He ordered them to stack up pillows behind his back.
sentences.cn: 他命令他们把几个枕头叠放在自己的背后。

sentences.en: He skimmed the pages quickly, then read them again more carefully.
sentences.cn: 他先快速地浏览页面，然后再细细阅读。

sentences.en: I know you will join me in wishing them Godspeed.
sentences.cn: 我知道你会同我一起祝愿他们诸事顺遂的。

sentences.en: I lent him several books, but he hasn’t read any of them.
sentences.cn: 我借给他几本书，但他一本还没看过。

sentences.en: If they value these data, let them pay for them.
sentences.cn: 他们要是看重这些数据，就让他们出钱买。

sentences.en: It's a constant struggle to try to keep them up to par.
sentences.cn: 要让他们达标，需要不断努力。

sentences.en: Mark was out of earshot, walking ahead of them.
sentences.cn: 马克走在前面，听不见他们的声音。

sentences.en: Quietly Mark poured and served drinks for all of them.
sentences.cn: 马克一声不响地给他们每人倒好饮料并端上来。

sentences.en: The police were very helpful when I spoke to them.
sentences.cn: 我和警察说了，他们很帮忙。

sentences.en: The savoury smell greeted them as they went through the door.
sentences.cn: 他们进门时一阵香味扑鼻而来。

sentences.en: They're freshly baked. I fetched them from the baker's this morning.
sentences.cn: 它们是刚出炉的。我早上去面包房买回来的。

sentences.en: We know some sex offenders dupe the psychologists who assess them.
sentences.cn: 我们知道有些性犯罪者会愚弄给他们做测评的心理学家。

sentences.en: We're taking relatively benign medicines and we're turning them into poisons.
sentences.cn: 我们服的药相对来说药性温和，但是我们却在把它们变成毒药。

trans.tran_en: used when talking about someone who may be male or female, to avoid saying ‘him or her’
used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
used to refer to two or more people or things that have already been mentioned or are already known about
